curriculum_stages.name: Basic Hit/Stand
curriculum_stages.description: Learn the basic strategy of when to hit and when to stand. Agent learns to avoid busting (going over 21) and to aim for a total close to 21 without going over.  Focus on identifying safe vs. risky hit situations relative to the dealer's upcard.

curriculum_stages.name: Adding Double Down
curriculum_stages.description: Introduce the 'Double Down' action. The agent learns to identify advantageous situations to double down (typically with a strong starting hand like 11 or a hard 10 against a weak dealer upcard). It will explore risk/reward of doubling and correctly estimating if one additional card will result in success.

curriculum_stages.name: Advanced Play
curriculum_stages.description: Advanced strategies of when to hit, stand, and double down including the understanding of soft totals (hands with an Ace that can be counted as 1 or 11). The agent masters complex decisions related to the dealer's up card and their effect on the agent's total.

curriculum_stages.name: Full Blackjack Strategy
curriculum_stages.description: Implement the full range of actions, including splitting pairs. The agent learns when splitting pairs is statistically advantageous, based on the specific pair and the dealer's upcard (e.g., splitting 8s or Aces). The agent must now handle multiple hands in the same round, potentially impacting rewards.
